alert.note: Alert for Lower Yukon Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 22 at 11:03AM AKDT until May 22 at 11:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues to be possible. * WHERE...The Yukon River from Grayling to Russian Mission, and along the Innoko River from Shageluk to 20 miles upstream. * WHEN...Until 10 PM AKDT this evening. * IMPACTS...A large ice jam upriver from Graying released yesterday and led to a significant ice jam run with rising water levels in Grayling this morning. The ice run has begun to think out but water levels still remain near bankfull. Residents in Anvik, Holy Cross, and Russia Mission will see a rapid rise in water levels over the next 24 hours. Water levels will rise to bankfull in some locations along with bank to bank runs of ice moving downriver. Additionally, the previous ice jam upriver from Grayling has caused a significant amount of water to flow over the banks of the Yukon River and into the Innoko River. River levels on the Innoko will continue to be high, though should begin to recede over the next couple of days as the dammed up water upstream on the Yukon flows downstream. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - An ice jam may cause water to infiltrate the lowlands along the river.
info.instruction: Residents are encouraged to monitor water levels along these areas of the Yukon and Innoko Rivers, and move items near the riverbank to higher ground.
